ourStory.title: Our Story
ourStory.text: Jaishiv and I met at our really good friends wedding (we were both part of their wedding party). The day before the wedding, there was a welcome party at a brewery. With a little of liquid courage, I (Kosha) had asked Jaishiv for his number with the excuse of wanting to coordinate a toast with the wedding party and the Bride and Groom. We hit it off immediately and the rest is history.

timeline.text: **Baarat**, the Groom is led to the marriage venue in a procession aaccompanied by family members, groomsmen, and friends known as baraatis.

**Ceremony**, the Hindu wedding ceremony is a union of two souls. THe rituals of the ceremony are based on the hymns contained in the Vedas, scared Hindu scriptures. The ceremony is consecrated in the presence of God, as represented by the five elements of nature, which play an integral role in the ceremony.

**Reception**, a celebration time for both the families as they rejoice over their new accord. The reception ceremony also serves as an opportunity for the bride to know the acquaintances and associates of the groom's family..
